attributes.action: Make companies legally obliged to pay mandatory breaks for professional drivers
attributes.background:
LGV and PCV Drivers are legally obliged to take unpaid breaks at very specific times, and can be fined, prosecuted or contracts terminated if they fail to do so.
Despite being unpaid, the drivers responsibility for the vehicle and load still remain, just so long as they are officially “not working”
attributes.additional_details:
It’s considered that a break is time off of work but for a professional Driver this is not the case. When stopping for a break the best scenario they can hope for is to be at a services. Not ideal but when considered that drivers also have to stop in lay-bys at small roads, it neither desirable or relaxing
In a 10 hour day, a Driver will typically be deducted 45mins pay because of his mandatory breaks, when they have barely left the place of work for even a few minutes

attributes.action: Call for a British Government apology for the Jallianwala Bagh Massacre of 1919
attributes.background: In 1919 Colonel Dyer ordered his men to fire, and maybe 1,000 peaceful protesters were left dead. At the time Winston Churchill proclaimed the massacre "monstrous" and the British Government condemned Dyer for his actions, but no apology has since been forthcoming. It is now time to apologise.

attributes.action: Prevent developers & land speculators from “gaming the system” in UK housing.
attributes.background:
Change the five year land supply to develop the right number of houses in the right places in accordance with a sustainable, relevant and up-to-date Local Plan.
Introduce a local measure of pipeline & delivery of homes to ensure that non-performing developers or land speculators can be identified.
attributes.additional_details:
Putting the right homes in the right places:
Where an LPA can openly show a supply of undelivered housing or land that exceeds a six year horizon to cover local population growth, there shall be no rights of appeal on the basis of land supply.
Measuring the pipeline and delivery of homes:
Where new homes aren’t registered with the LPA at a rate in accordance with plans set out and agreed with that LPA, then DCLG shall have the right to declare the developers / land speculators as non-performing.

attributes.action: Make diagnosis enough for children with SEN to get the help and provision needed
attributes.background: Throughout the UK there are thousands of children struggling in mainstream school. My son is one of many. He is Aspergers/ADHD. He needs a specialist provision and one on one support. He and all of the other children are made to fail the system before they qualify for help. Something needs to change
attributes.additional_details:
* Diagnosis should be enough for a specialist provision
* Support should be given immediately to children whose parents choose for them to stay in mainstream
* Children have to fail in mainstream before they can get assistance, the system is failing our children
* EHCP process takes too long
* Funding needs to be increased
* We need more specialist schools
* ALL children deserve the right to an education in a setting that suits their needs.
* SEN Children need SEN support

attributes.action: Hold a General Election if the Government  avoids an Opposition Day vote again.
attributes.background:
Government abstained from the Opposition Day vote on Universal Credit (18/10/17), insulting both democracy & Parliament.

In the words of John Bercow: “This institution is bigger than any one party & is bigger than any government”

If the Government doesn’t respect this then we must replace it.

attributes.action: I would like all military veterans to receive free train travel in the UK
attributes.background:
To support current military veterans and homeless veterans with free travel on trains within the UK to support with social, mental welfare and support.
Reducing stress, anxiety and the chance to mix with likeminded persons who may also be suffering with issues from leaving the services.
attributes.additional_details: Currently veterans will meet annually to mix with old comrades and to get the feeling of support that we don’t feel we get from our normal lives. The people missing from these events are the homeless Vets and PTSD suffers who struggle on a daily basis. I see this as an area that other Vets can support struggling veterans with one to one meetings or planned events. This could reduce suicides and reduce strains on the NHS. The number of travel could be set minimum of 3 per year.

attributes.action: Make desecration of war memorials and symbols of remembrance a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
War memorials were constructed at the center of towns and villages so that people could be reminded of the sacrifices made by brave men and women who died to preserve our freedom.
Poppies and other items are placed at these memorials to ensure we do not forget those sacrifices.
attributes.additional_details:
There are now too many instances of people that think it is in order to desecrate these memorials, poppies and other items which are there to remind us of a debt owed to the many that gave their lives so that we could be free.
Desecrating of war memorials, items purchased and placed on these memorials are to be respected.
Whatever political, religious or ethnic issues people may have, their argument cannot be with the fallen heroes of another generation.

attributes.action: Enshrine in law that foreign nationals hold medical insurance before entry to UK
attributes.background: The NHS is free at point of contact for all. Foreign Nationals often use the NHS then leave the country without paying for treatment. I therfore petition parliament to enshrine in law that ALL Foreigners should hold medical insurance and must prove that they hold this before entering the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The UK needs to look after the NHS and nurture it. We have the finest health care system in the world. But it can no longer cope with the influx and lack of funding. Making sure that foreign nationals have health insurance before they enter the UK will help elevate some of the funding issues the NHS currently has. It will also eliminate health tourism and free up appointments that are much needed for UK Nationals.

attributes.action: Regulate land management companies: cap charges and increase transparency
attributes.background: Cap land maintenance price increases at the same rate as inflation to stop large price increases (we had nearly 30% this year); require management fees to be fixed in contracts, to stop extra fees; and require invoices for extra charges to prove works are carried out and not to be excessive.
attributes.additional_details: I live on an estate which has green areas owned by a company which charges home owners for maintaining this land. They charge for works with no proof of work being carried out. This year they raised the price by 29.4% per month raising the price by £53.18 a month, costing an extra £638.16 per year! The company do not carry out the agreed works properly and demand payments or legal action will be taken against home owners for non-payment. The company also do not deal with complaints efficiently.

attributes.action: Ban animal testing (vivisection) in the UK completely
attributes.background: With the new advanced technology we have today we can now replace the use of animals in testing labs. Over 160,000 people still die every year by using drugs that have tested 'safe' on animals which proves the results are inaccurate.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year in the UK (not including Northern Ireland) Around 4 million procedures take place on animals such as Dogs, horses, mice, rats, cats, rabbits, primates and guinea pigs. 
Lab animals are left to suffer with no pain relief during the course of the experiment which can, at times last for weeks before they are killed. 
We now have technology that can replace this and end the cruelty and suffering of millions of animals per year saving both humans and animals.

attributes.action: Debate: The EU referendum is now invalid due to demographic changes over time.
attributes.background: 1.2m people made up the leave majority. 600,000 uk people die each year, the same join the electorate. 2/3 of older voters are leavers. 2/3 of younger voters are remainders. The referendum is valid for a short time only before it ceases to represent the will of the people.

attributes.action: Require local authorities to adopt all Public Open Space and roads on estates
attributes.background: Local authorities are avoiding increasing their grounds maintenance responsibilities on new private estates by requiring developers to form management companies to deal with the maintenance long term. These management fees are an extra tax on hard working families. Councils should adopt the land.
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities used to be paid commuted sums by housing developers to adopt open land and roads. Local authorities would be responsible for the long term maintenance for these assets. In practice, management companies are established for some roads and public open spaces to be maintained long term. Management companies charge excessive amounts for in effect a second “council tax”. The government should force all local authorities to adopt all roads and public open space on private estates.

attributes.action: Ban protesters from wearing facial coverings during demonstrations.
attributes.background: With the rise of Antifa, Right / Left wing demonstrations and violence, the hiding of faces to thwart identification of those who have committed criminal offences has become very prevalent it is a hinderance to later detection and a detriment to security.

attributes.action: Full labelling on ALL goods regarding animal ingredients or use in production
attributes.background: Full labelling on ALL goods regarding animal ingredients e.g. animal fat in fabric softener and isinglass (swim bladder of fish) in wine production.  A simple label that there IS or IS NOT any animal ingredient or derivative used at any stage of manufacture without constantly searching the internet.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like it made mandatory that all products ie, tyre, decorating materials, household cleaners, garden products, clothes and footwear, to be clearly marked that they contain animal derivatives such as gelatin, animal based glues, and shellac.  In other words, everything that is sold in the UK. The Co-op already state on the front of their cleaning products etc. whether there is no animal ingredients.
Many items marked cruelty free still contain animal ingredients which causes confusion.

attributes.action: Make Parental Alienation a Criminal act that can carry a custodial sentence.
attributes.background: If a Parent, Grandparent, Guardian, Relative or Organisation that is stopping a child from seeing their biological parents or parents on their birth certificate, without a lawful reason (Child safety with formal proof) should be given a custodial sentence, like Brazil.
attributes.additional_details: The Case Of John William Greer Vs Pauline Hutchinson and Larne First Serve Community Social Services (1997) - Father when to court to gain custody after being denied access to his son.

attributes.action: Introduce a national awareness day specifically against plastic in our seas.
attributes.background: People are increasingly aware of how plastic, in all forms, is endangering sea and marine life. It doesn’t decay, possibly for centuries and we’re adding millions of new tons every year. Soon there will be more plastic than life in the sea.
attributes.additional_details: A National Awareness Day is the answer; a day on which all anti-plastic in the sea organisations and individuals could come together to maximise awareness. Britain’s ties to the sea are strong (historical, cultural, economic, geographic) and it would be great if our Government was the first to announce such a national day. Having a National Awareness Day is a win, win, win; for the oceans, people and politicians. There is currently no anti plastic in the sea day, we need one.

attributes.action: Enshrine in law that on 29 March 2019 at 23:00 the NHS gets an extra 350million.
attributes.background: The British people voted on the 23rd June 2016 to give the NHS an extra £350million per week. This is the will of the British people and we will not tolerate any attempt to block this via the back door. Many of the people making this promise are in government today, and must be held to account.
attributes.additional_details:
Current members of the cabinet made this promise very clearly and in exit polls this was given as one of the main reasons for voting to leave the EU.

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/tony-blair-theresa-may-win-general-election-jeremy-corbyn-labour-leader-uk-prime-minister-a7705026.html

attributes.action: Stop oversized and hazardous goods vehicles using the Dartford Tunnel
attributes.background: We’re a logistics business headquartered in Dartford and we’ve officially had enough of the Dartford traffic jam. Our simple solution: Stop oversized & hazardous goods vehicles using the Dartford Tunnel.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose a simple solution: Stop the Convoys and get Dartford moving. Traffic at the Dartford Tunnel is brought to a standstill on average 100 times a day by a small number of oversized & hazardous goods vehicles which need to be escorted through the tunnel, in a convoy. 
Each convoy can take up to 2.5 mins to travel through the tunnel, and a tunnel is closed around every 15 mins. 
Why should 99% of drivers suffer due to less than 1% of vehicles? 
Our suggestion is simple: Stop these oversized/hazardous vehicles using the tunnel & send them the other way around the M25.

attributes.action: Make General Dental Council (GDC) a tax-payer funded organisation.
attributes.background:
The General Dental Councils remit is to work for patients whilst working with dentists.
It is now time for the funding of this body to be reviewed and for it to be paid for out of general taxation.

attributes.action: Help get SDR (selective dorsal Rhizotomy) operation on the NHS
attributes.background: Selective Dorsal Rhizotomy (SDR) is a neurosurgical procedure aimed at reducing spasticity (tight and stiff muscle tone) in the lower limbs. It's most commonly used for children with spastic diplegia (two limbs affected) which accounts for 25 to 30% of children born with cerebral palsy.
attributes.additional_details: In the UK, the National Institute of Clinical Excellence (NICE) has issued guidance demonstrating that SDR is most effective for children between 3 and 10 years of age.

attributes.action: Make Helmet Therapy for Babies free on the NHS.
attributes.background:
Helmet therapy is for babies who suffer from Plagiocephaly or Bracheycephaly (flat head syndrome).
This can be developed in the first few months of the baby being born due to favouring sleeping on the one side or one way causing the skull to loose shape, and also causing facial deformities.
attributes.additional_details:
This treatment has been proven to work with a positive, visual outcome in all babies that go through Helmet Therapy around the world!  It's currently not available on the NHS forcing parents to pay over £2,000 for the treatment on their own.
I have a 7 month old son going through Helmet Therapy and the results already are dramatic! Most parents can not afford this and really don't understand why it is not available on the NHS? Helmet therapy does work and needs more awareness raised!

attributes.action: Require hospitals to reinstate life support if a patient survives for 15 mins.
attributes.background: There have been several cases in the media recently where hospitals have gone to court to get permission to remove life-support from children. This has been done on the premise that they would not live long after it was removed. This has not always been the case.
attributes.additional_details: Introducing this legislation would clarify existing law on the prohibition of euthanasia to bring peace of mind to troubled parents and restore confidence in the NHS, which is being maligned worldwide as a result of these cases. A doctor should be present to reintroduce support throughout the wait.

attributes.action: Rule that freeholders must cover safety related costs of their buildings
attributes.background: On June 14 2017, 71 people saw there lives cut short after the Grenfell Tower was destroyed by fire, and all survivors have seen their lives hopelessly changed. The same type of cladding, which played a key role in the tragedy by allowing the fire to spread, has been found on more than 250 blocks.
attributes.additional_details:
Leaseholders of many private blocks are being charged for all implemented measures, even though Sajid Javid, DCLG Secretary urged owners/management companies not to do so. Replacement works worth £millions won't start until funds are in place, endangering lives. 

Let’s join together to ask Government to rule formally that freeholders are responsible for costs of ensuring the safety of our buildings and provide economic support to guarantee prompt implementation of whatever measures needed.

attributes.action: Protect vulnerable debtors in enforceable Taking Control of Goods ​Regulations
attributes.background: Taking Control of Goods National Standards contains guidance for Enforcement Agents when dealing with vulnerable debtors - this guidance is unclear and results in vulnerable people being exploited unnecessarily and new Regulations to clarify this should be debated by Parliament
attributes.additional_details: Give stronger support to vulnerable council tax debtors than provided in T​aking Control of Goods​, National Standards for Enforcement Agents​ paras 70-78 Vulnerable Situations. Local Authority should be advised not to send bailiffs to collect the tax from households which have no income due to zero hours contract, benefit sanction or Universal Credit. Bailiffs should be required to report those circumstances​ in households they call on ​to the local authority with out taking any further action.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory all processed meat products carry a Government health warning
attributes.background:
In 2015 the World Health Organisation classified all processed meat products as group 1 carcinogens after extensive studies proved them to be a known cause of colorectal cancer
To date the Government has not acted responsibly and  failed to make this information widely known to the general public.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like to see a proper campaign to enlighten the public of the health risks if they are consuming these products, starting with making it mandatory to include a Government health warning on the packing of all processed meat products and removing all processed meat products  from schools. 

Link to the World Health Organisation information regarding processed meat:
http://www.who.int/features/qa/cancer-red-meat/en/

attributes.action: Ban greyhound racing, and all exports of dogs to any country including the eu
attributes.background: The greyhound racing industry is unable to regulate itself or stick to welfare restrictions. Injured dogs and those who do not make it to the races in the first place are abandoned or killed. Dogs exported abroad end up bred and/ or raced in countries with no welfare protection. Please end this.
attributes.additional_details: Please. Let's end this cruel and outdated industry now. Don't believe anyone who says there are strict welfare standards. They are not followed. Dogs are suffering here in the uk today. The dogs sent abroad, often via EU countries, to China, Pakistan etc, suffer even more. Make this a civilised country which protects those with no voice. Greyhounds and sighthounds are great companions. Racing is under 100 years old. It needs to stop now. Please.

attributes.action: Support the secession of Catalonia from The Kingdom of Spain
attributes.background: The people of Catalonia have voted overwhelmingly to leave Spain despite the attempts of the Spanish Government to stop them. The United Kingdom should recognize the will of the Catalan people and support their peaceful secession from the Kingdom of Spain along with recognizing their independence.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom respected the will of the Scottish people to hold a referendum and when the result came they respected that as well. The Spanish government has failed miserably to do either of these things. The UK, as a nation which respects the wishes of it's minorities should thus support the Catalan bid for independence and recognize their independence if they chose to declare it. They should also aid the diplomatic efforts to secure a peaceful secession of Catalonia.

attributes.action: Move the last Bank Holiday in May, into June
attributes.background: Two bank holidays in May create a problem for employers.

attributes.action: Stop development on Green Belt land and prevent de-designation of Green Belt.
attributes.background: We call upon Parliament to fully support measures to stop development on green belt land and to prevent de-designation of green belt land, to halt the coalescence of villages such as Kings Langley into neighbouring towns thus permanently losing their character.
attributes.additional_details: Green Belt is under increasing threat and it is time to say 'enough' - no more building on precious open spaces between towns and villages because it is irreplaceable.  There are other places to build than on the Green Belt - keep it untouched for the generations to follow.

attributes.action: Use Foreign Aid budget for the NHS, Adult Social care and the elderly.
attributes.background: The Foreign Aid budget currently stands at £13bn. This is far too high. We believe charity begins at home and that the Foreign Aid budget should be used for the NHS, Adult Social care and the elderly who have been the backbone of our country.

attributes.action: Introduce proper effective regulation of implantable medical devices
attributes.background:
Repeated scandals involving medical devices show that the current regulatory system is not fit for purpose
Tighten regulation of medical devices so that:
- High risk medical devices have clinical trial evidence at the time of approval
- There is a publicly accessible registry for such devices
attributes.additional_details:
There have been multiple scandals over implanted medical devices, including pacemakers, TVT meshes, breast implants, & metal hip joints.

Current rules mean manufacturers don't have to produce clinical trial evidence before CE safety marking & use in patients. Equivalence allows a new device to be waved through if a manufacturer declares it similar to an existing product, even if those other products have had safety concerns.

Reference: BMJ Open 2017;7:e017125
doi: 10.1136/bmjopen-2017-017125

attributes.action: Make parking of ICE vehicles at EV charging points a more serious offence
attributes.background: Dedicated charging points for EV across the country are regularly and deliberately occupied by conventional ICE vehicles. This causes unnecessary stress for EV drivers as, unlike conventional cars, electric vehicles require charging points and attached parking place to be able to move.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, there are more than 100k plug-in vehicles in the UK. These cars require charging points to be able to move and in most cases such points are placed within parking areas for conventional cars. Although clearly marked as such, many of the points are obstructed by ICE vehicles, deliberately parking in EV-dedicated slots. This became a chronic symptom across the country and causes unnecessary stress for drivers. Local councils are not doing enough to protect rights of EV community.

attributes.action: Maximum 30 day wait for anyone needing counselling for mental health issues
attributes.background: As someone who has battled mental health issues for the last 20 years. I’m sick of going to my G.P. and being told there’s a minimum 3 month waiting list. This isn’t good enough. I’m requesting that a maximum wait of 30 days be instilled.
attributes.additional_details:
It is wrong that depending on where you live, decides how quickly you receive NHS support for mental health. It is grossly under funded and massively under resourced.
5 times in the last 10 years I have been told there is a minimum 3 month wait for help, this is in the Richmond (York’s) constituency, one of the wealthiest in the country.
So I want a maximum 30 day wait.

attributes.action: Replace small plastic bags for loose food products with brown paper ones
attributes.background: By 2050 there will be more plastic in our oceans than fish. We therefore call on the Government to make compulsory changes within all UK supermarkets for the removal of small plastic bags used for loose food products such as fruit, veg, and baked goods and instead, reintroduce brown paper ones.
attributes.additional_details: There are 1 trillion plastic bags made each year with each one taking up to 1000 years to fully decompose, and an even larger figure of 3.95 trillion bags ending up in the world's oceans annually. Brown paper bags, on the other hand, have a degradable period of 1 month and are 100% natural and renewable.  With over 100,000 marine creatures dying a year from plastic pollution and over 1 million seabirds, we are certain that this small change will make a big difference.

attributes.action: The Scottish Government should be called the Scottish Executive.
attributes.background: The description of Scotland's devolved administration as a 'Government' causes confusion about its constitutional remit, which has led to considerable over-reach by devolved bodies into reserved matters. This duplication is contentious, costly, and detracts from the good governance of Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: We petition Parliament to repeal section 12 of the Scotland Act 2012.

attributes.action: Halt the cuts to the Metropolitan Police budget
attributes.background:
Having lost £600 million in real terms over the past 7 years, the Metropolitan Police face a further £400 million cut over the next 4 years.

70 per cent of all police spending in London comes from the Home Office, meaning that any change in that funding has a disproportionate effect.

attributes.action: Introduce sanctions to STOP anonymous, false & malicious complaints to Ofsted.
attributes.background:
For too long those in the education & care sector have been at the mercy of disgruntled employees and/or families who are able to make anonymous, malicious & false complaints to Ofsted. 
The impact can be detrimental to the organisation involved & is costing the UK tax payer unnecessarily.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact on the organisation can be detrimental if the malicious complaint becomes public. Resulting in a tarnished reputation and/or closure of a service in come instances.

We are petitioning for Ofsted & the Government to introduce fines to those making false & malicious complaints. 
This means no more anonymous complaints can be received. 

This change will safeguard organisations, save money & help tighten up Ofsted's complaints procedures.

attributes.action: Correct the flaws in our First-Past-The-Post voting system.
attributes.background:
Add score voting to the FPTP ballot; to correct its flaws, improve on its ability to produce strong governments, and strengthen its direct constituency link

Stand by 2011 AV referendum result by keeping the first past the post selection of MPs defining FPTP, but address the issues that lead to it
attributes.additional_details:
FPTP Currently: a voter marks one candidate, voters' marks are tallied, and the candidate with the highest total wins

W/ Score Voting: a voter scores each candidate, voters' scores are tallied, and the candidate with the highest total wins

A minor ballot change can fix all of FPTP's flaws AND add to its strengths

Simple guide: endfptp.reddit.com/6xtbgh

Comprehensive guide: rangevoting.org

2017 GE Simulated w/ Score voting: endfptp.reddit.com/6lctda

Score vs. PR: endfptp.reddit.com/6gur0e

attributes.action: Proscribe Britain First
attributes.background: Britain First are an ultra far right group, they have a paramilitary wing called the "Britain First Defence Force". They organise ‘days of action’ that target a specific demographic namely Muslims, they use these days of actions to harass Muslims in shops, on the street or in mosques.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of its campaigners have also been banned from every mosque in England and Wales for their actions.
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/britain-first-banned-from-all-mosques-in-england-and-wales-after-police-take-out-injunction-a7196831.html

attributes.action: Change immigration Rules and accept full time study in UK as proof of English
attributes.background: My son is 18 years old and has 7 years of full time study in UK. He is first year at University now and has ABBBB in Higher Mathematics,English,Physics,Chemistry and Biology.His application for British Citizenship has being refused because had No prove of Speaking and Understanding English Language.
attributes.additional_details: Please help our immigrant children, who have being taught in English and have learned the British values, not to be humiliated and accept their years of study in this country as proof of English. After seven years of study in the United Kingdom it is unacceptable to be asked to give one more test to prove they can speak and understand the English language. Please sign this petition to change this abusive rule and help our children. Thank you for taking your time to read my petition.

attributes.action: Allow carers to study more than 21 hours a week and claim Carers Allowance
attributes.background:
Carers cannot be in full time education and claim Carers Allowance even if they are caring for the 35-hours a week to make them eligible for this benefit. 
This particularly discriminates against young adult carers reaching their full potential in life. 
See www.fixers.org.uk (Lucy Prentice)
attributes.additional_details:
There are 168 hours in each week, so even after deducting 35 hours of caring this still leaves 133 hours which the carer should be able to spend as they wish without restriction in the same way that anyone in paid employment can. It is completely feasible that a carer can provide the number of caring hours required to meet the eligibility for Carers Allowance and still study full time around their caring role.
Please see the film by Lucy Prentice and other young adult carers at www.fixers.org.uk

attributes.action: Have a national two minute silence on May 22 at 11am for the Manchester victims
attributes.background: We would like to create a two minute silence nationally in remembrance of the 22 who tragically lost their lives in the Manchester arena bombing last May. We need as much help as possible to raise awareness and show the world that love wins- always.

attributes.action: Make General Practice recognised as a specialism in the UK
attributes.background: General practice is the foundation of the NHS, yet even though doctors undergo rigorous training to become a GP, including an exit exam (MRCGP) they are still not recognised as specialists. The UK is an outlier compared to other countries across the globe.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently UEMO (the European Union of General Practitioners/Family Physicians) called for all European countries to recognise the speciality and the statement has the support of other European 
medical organisations.

In August 2016 the RCGP released this press statement http://www.rcgp.org.uk/news/2016/august/gps-must-be-recognised-as-specialists-in-general-practice-say-rcgp-and-the-bma.aspx , but to date there continues to be no movement on their call.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to offer a Vegan option in KS1 free school meals.
attributes.background: Currently schools will provide meals for children, who are following vegetarian diets, have allergies and avoid foods due to faith, but they do not provide a Vegan option and some Children who wish to follow a vegan diet are not able to. It should be law that schools provide vegan options.
attributes.additional_details: Some schools will accommodate and adjust meals for vegan children, this is not standard in all schools and some parents are told to provide packed lunches, Schools will provide a vegetarian and meat option, excluding vegan children from participating in school dinners. Children should have the choice to be able to choose a vegan option on the menu, everyday. No child should ever feel left out because of a life choice they have made, veganism should be widely accessible to all children.

attributes.action: Stop plans to exempt vehicles more than 40 years old from roadworthiness tests
attributes.background:
The Department for Transport has announced that it intends to exempt most vehicles that are more than 40 years old from annual roadworthiness tests (MoT) from May 2018.

The Government should reconsider this and aim for all vehicles to be given independent annual inspections for safety reasons.
attributes.additional_details: When respondents to the Government’s consultation were asked whether these vehicles – including many classic cars  and motorcycles – should be exempted from MoT tests, more than half were opposed. The DfT's own figures indicate that only 6% of pre-1960 vehicles, already exempt, are voluntarily tested. If this is also the case for vehicles over 40 years old when the exemption is introduced then there is a risk that safety-critical faults on more than 293,000 vehicles will not be detected.

attributes.action: Introduce an animal abuser registry in the UK
attributes.background: Animal abuse should be recorded in a database similar to ViSOR, in the UK. A registry should be introduced that records the name, date of birth, offence, conviction date and expiration date of all known animal abusers, preventing them from adopting a pet or working with animals in any capacity.
attributes.additional_details: There is a strong correlation between animal abuse and domestic violence between humans. Furthermore, there are countless recorded cases of serial killers having tortured animals before moving onto crimes against humans. With this in mind, the registry would not only protect animals and pets from abuse, but also, potentially, humans. The USA is already taking steps to enforce these laws in several areas, although Tennessee is the only place to implement a state-wide registry.

attributes.action: End the new flight restrictions on passengers travelling from Northern Cyprus
attributes.background: In light of recent security policies in the USA, the UK has followed suit by insisting that passengers in transit from Ercan airport to Stansted (or U.K.) undertake extensive additional security checks at Istanbul airport.
attributes.additional_details:
Many passengers have been flying to London via a touch-down in Turkey for over 40 years without incident. Therefore This is perceived as a political decision. It has nothing to do with security. Ercan is one of the safest airports in the world.

This situation impacts the elderly and disabled, driving passengers south to Larnaca or Paphos airports.

We urge the UK government to reverse this policy immediately.

attributes.action: Reinstate the rail link from Poulton le Fylde to Fleetwood Lancashire
attributes.background: The rail link was closed in 1980’s. There is a need in Fleetwood for decent transport links on the grounds of deprivation and poor economy. People have to travel for an hour during rush hour to get to the nearest station 5 miles away. Commuter rail is essential to rebuild our economy.
attributes.additional_details: Fleetwood is on a peninsula and since the 1970’s has been in decline. We now have a division one football club, the only one with no rail link, and things are on the up though people cannot get in and out of town for university and work due to its positioning on the Fylde coast. We are a beautiful town with an amazing coastline which we cannot share properly due to poor transport links. Most of the track is in place just no trains running. Fleetwood has great potential please help it thrive.

attributes.action: Change the law so that rape can be classed as a terrorist offence
attributes.background: Targeting women & children with the heinous act of rape based on race, colour or religious, non religious & political beliefs, is a conscious form of illicit psychological warfare, genocide, &/or so-called ethnic cleansing as recognised by the UN Security Council under the 1820 resolution.
attributes.additional_details:
Amnesty International reports that all around the world military commanders are using rape to 'terrorize' humiliate and demoralize communities. Amnesty International, OHCHR, UNICEF, Military Chiefs, Govts all understand and know this undeniable fact.

These same tactics are being used in the UK. We need to recognise and understand that these are acts of terrorism.

attributes.action: Give the blood bike community section 19 exemptions for blue light runs
attributes.background:
There are 27 blood bike groups up and down the UK that respond to a call for help every night from their local NHS.
They willingly transport urgent medical supplies from hospital or hospital overnight free and voluntarily.
Help us get the emergency delivery to its destination sooner with S19
attributes.additional_details:
At present if the selected rider/driver receives a Blue Light call they can not:
• exceed the speed limit
• treat a red light as a give way
• go to the right of a keep left barrier
• Use audible warning equipment

E.G.
it's 2am, nothing on the road, they still have to:
• travel along EVERY road at the speed limit
• stand at a red light with nothing using the green light.

If we are granted section 19's that few minutes could be the difference in saving a life someday
